I'd define a protected void exit(int statusCode) method which calls
System.exit(statusCode) in the production class, but test cases use a
subclass which senses the value of the status code.

Directly influenced by Michael Feathers' book. Ever since I read it, I've
been making more of my private methods protected and then using subclasses
in my tests. This has helped me to create a lot more tests, which I like,
but probably breaks encapsulation to some extent, which I'm not losing any
sleep over.

James
